content: Great! How are you doing today? What's on your mind?
I’m... okay, I guess. I’m feeling pretty drained, honestly. I haven’t been sleeping much recently, and it’s starting to catch up with me. There’s just a lot weighing on me right now.

It sounds like you're carrying quite a bit right now, and the lack of sleep is making it feel even harder. Feeling drained can make everything feel more overwhelming. Would you like to talk about what's been weighing on you, or about how the sleep troubles have been affecting you?

I think it’s mostly my job. Things have been really stressful at work, and I’m constantly worrying about getting fired. It’s hard to shut my brain off at night—my thoughts are all over the place, especially thinking about what would happen if I can’t support my family.

It sounds like the stress from work and the fear of job insecurity are really taking up a lot of mental space for you, and the worry about your family’s well-being adds to that weight. It makes sense that it’s been hard to quiet your mind at night with so much on your plate. How have you been managing these feelings so far?

Honestly, I don’t think I’ve been managing them well at all. I try to distract myself by scrolling on my phone or watching TV to drown out the thoughts, but it doesn’t really help. It’s like the more I try not to think about it, the harder it is to stop.

It sounds like you’ve been doing what you can to cope, even if it doesn’t feel very effective. It’s tough when your mind just won’t give you a break, no matter how much you try to distract yourself. What do you think might make those thoughts feel less overwhelming, even just a little?

I don’t know. If I knew how to make it stop, I probably wouldn’t be here. Maybe if I didn’t feel so much pressure at work, it would help, but I don’t see how that’s going to change anytime soon. It’s just this constant anxious loop.

It sounds like the pressure at work feels unavoidable right now, which leaves you caught in this cycle of anxiety. That must feel pretty exhausting. Even though you’re not sure how to make it stop, it’s clear you want things to be different. What would life look like for you if the pressure weren’t so intense, at work or in your mind?
